posts.title: Versailles
posts.excerpt: The young mother Nina and her son Enzo find themselves sleeping on the streets of Paris. Their tentative lifestyle eventually leads them to Versailles. posts.title: Daguerréotypes
posts.excerpt: Quote:Originally shot in the mid-’70s, Agnès Varda’s vérité documentary Daguerréotypes has aged splendidly, acquiring flavors that would’ve been inconceivable at the time it was made. posts._title: Ognjen Svilicic – Takva su pravila AKA These Are the Rules (2014)
posts.title: Takva su pravila
posts.excerpt: After their son has been beaten up in the street, parents find their world of false security collapsing and have to re-examine their lives and question everything into what they believed.

posts.title: Frankenstein and the Monster from Hell

posts.title: Frankenstein
posts.excerpt: Henry Frankenstein is a doctor who is trying to discover a way to make the dead walk. He succeeds and creates a monster that has to deal with living again.

posts._title: Byambasuren Davaa – Das Lied von den zwei Pferden AKA The Two Horses of Genghis Khan (2009)
posts.title: Das Lied von den zwei Pferden
posts.excerpt: SummaryA promise, an old, destroyed horse head violin and a song believed lost lead the singer Urna back to Outer Mongolia.
